meanings.definition: A political ideology opposed to liberalism, often characterized by authoritarianism and a lack of respect for individual rights.
meanings.sent1: The country's illiberalism led to restrictions on freedom of speech.
meanings.sent2: His support for illiberalism made him unpopular among those who valued personal freedoms.
meanings.sent3: The illiberalism of the government was so extreme, they banned all forms of dissenting opinions.
meanings.sent4: The illiberalism of the regime cast a dark shadow over the citizens' daily lives.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of illiberalism were felt by all, as basic rights were stripped away.
